intro: Galium verum proles ruthenicum, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
